abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

inlineContent.text: The tvOS 13 SDK provides support for developing tvOS apps for Apple TV devices running tvOS 13. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 11 available from the Mac App Store. For information on the compatibility requirements for Xcode 11, see
is not currently supported on tvOS. (50897359)

now supports encoding video with alpha channels using HEVC. Videos encoded in this manner are broadly supported in AVFoundation APIs, and by Safari within web pages. Technical details of the format can be found in the Interoperability Profile specification. (8045917)
doesn’t render the default glyph image. (52143655)
doesn’t render the markers for annotations using the default tint color. (51908728)
delegate callback might not function as expected. (54309264)

Removed support for FTP and File URL schemes for Proxy Automatic Configuration (PAC). HTTP and HTTPS are the only supported URL schemes for PAC. This affects all PAC configurations including, but not limited to, configurations set using Settings, System Preferences, Profiles, and
APIs no longer support SPDY. Servers should use HTTP 2 or HTTP 1.1. (43391641)
structure has four new properties for reading accessibility values from the environment:
for consistency with the more general
, and should now be sent before the object changes rather than after it changes. This change allows for improved coalescing of change notifications. (51580731)

Updated the APIs for creating animations. The basic animations are now named after the curve type — such as
, depending on whether or not the animation is driven interactively. (50280375)
Added an initializer for creating a
instances don’t use resizing information configured in asset catalogs. Configure the size of an image using the
protocol is deprecated in favor of dedicated
modifiers are deprecated. Use other modifiers like
, properties in the new tab bar appearance API aren’t reflected on the screen. (49792597)
is now available in the Simulator. (45101325)

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
A mechanism for generating requests to authenticate users based on their Apple ID.
A controller that manages authorization requests that a provider creates.
A mechanism for generating requests to perform keychain credential sharing.
Downloads a proxy autoconfiguration script and executes it.
A font object.
An annotation view that displays a balloon-shaped marker at the designated location.
An image to display in the marker balloon.
The background color of the marker balloon.
A Core Animation layer that Metal can render into, typically displayed onscreen.
A sequence whose elements can be traversed multiple times, nondestructively, and accessed by an indexed subscript.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
Moves all the elements at the specified offsets to the specified destination offset, preserving ordering.
A collection that supports replacement of an arbitrary subrange of elements with the elements of another collection.
Removes all the elements at the specified offsets from the collection.
An animation that combines the behaviors of in and out easing animations.
A convenience for a `spring` animation with a lower `response` value, intended for driving interactive animations.

An interpolating spring animation that uses a damped spring model to produce values in the range [0, 1] that are then used to interpolate within the [from, to] range of the animated property. Preserves velocity across overlapping animations by adding the effects of each animation.
An animation that moves at a constant speed.

A persistent spring animation. When mixed with other `spring()` or `interactiveSpring()` animations on the same property, each animation will be replaced by their successor, preserving velocity from one animation to the next. Optionally blends the response values between springs over a time period.
A collection of environment values propagated through a view hierarchy.
Whether the system preference for Differentiate without Color is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Invert Colors is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Reduce Motion is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Reduce Transparency is enabled.
An environment-dependent font.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
A view that displays an image.
Sets the mode by which SwiftUI resizes an image to fit its space.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
Sets the color of the text displayed by this view.
Presents an action sheet when a given condition is true.
Presents an alert to the user.
Sets the color of the foreground elements displayed by this view.
Positions this view within an invisible frame with the specified size.
Presents a sheet when a binding to a Boolean value that you provide is true.
The tint color to apply to the selection indicator image.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
A collection of unique integer values that represent the indexes of elements in another collection.
An object that enables you to start and stop URL requests.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
A dictionary containing information about the proxy to use within this session.
Tells the delegate that the task is waiting until suitable connectivity is available before beginning the network load.
